comment: /**  * Get the type as class.  *  * @return the class which represents the selected type.  */
code: /**  * Get the type as class.  *  * @return the class which represents the selected type.  */ public Class<? extends ErrorHandlerBuilder> getTypeAsClass() {     switch(this) {         case DefaultErrorHandler:             return DefaultErrorHandlerBuilder.class.         case DeadLetterChannel:             return DeadLetterChannelBuilder.class.         case NoErrorHandler:             return NoErrorHandlerBuilder.class.         default:             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unknown error handler: " + this).     } }
